FuncDef:
The tunnel avp46 command enables AVP46 on a tunnel to record the cause for the user log-out.
The undo tunnel avp46 command disables AVP46 on a tunnel.
By default, AVP46 is disabled on a tunnel.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the tunnel avp46 command is run, the STOPCCN packet sent by a device to the peer contains the tunnel-deleting cause as soon as the tunnel is deleted.
If the tunnel avp46 command is configured, the device sends to the RADIUS server the Huawei-specific attribute HW-L2TP-Terminate-Cause in the format of Disconnect Code (2 bytes) + Control Protocol Number (2 bytes) + Direction (1 byte) + L2TP AVP46 information (0 to 64 bytes).
If the tunnel avp46 command is not configured, the device sends to the RADIUS server the Huawei-specific attribute HW-L2TP-Terminate-Cause in the format of Disconnect Code (2 bytes) + Control Protocol Number (2 bytes) + Direction (1 byte) + Validity (1 byte) + L2TP AVP46 information (0 to 64 bytes).
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
